intro: Cyclosorus subcoriaceus, commonly known as the rough cyclosorus, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a thalloid plant characterized by its leafy, branched structure and a distinctive, rugged surface texture. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rock crevices. Its leaves are closely arranged and have a slightly rough, scaly appearance. Cyclosorus subcoriaceus plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
